intro: Acinodendron aspergillare, commonly known as the rough-hair acinodendron, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems covered in rough, hairy texture. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a leathery texture and dark green color. Acinodendron aspergillare is often found in moist, shaded habitats within forest understories.
